items.content_html:
Iâ€™m really enjoying Puzzmo, Zach Gage and Orta Theroxâ€™s new puzzle service thatâ€™s taking on the likes of the NYT crosswords and related games. The interface is slick and I love being able to play and compete with my friends and family.

How many Moms are on Puzzmo besides mine? ğŸ˜‚

items.content_html: I have next to zero interest in the little AI pin that Humane is putting out. I fail to see its benefits over the devices we already have strapped to our wrists or in our pockets. I welcome the competition but itâ€™s an uphill battle for sure. Who is the target market for this? Will I ever see one in the wild?

items.content_html:
I bought an M2 Max MBP earlier this year. I was initially bummed that the M3 Max seemed like a significant leap forward but got over it quickly as even the M2 Max is overkill for my use case.

Today, I learned that the new MBPs charge at 140W over USB-C and Iâ€™m back to being a bit salty. ğŸ˜…

items.title: My App Defaults
items.content_html:
Recently, folks have been sharing their default apps in a bunch of different categories. (Iâ€™m told the podcast Hemispheric Views started this. I plan on listening soon.)

Iâ€™m a sucker for learning about other peopleâ€™s workflows and seeing how I can make better use of my time, so this was right up my alley.

In recent years I have drastically simplified the amount of third party apps I use. I felt like I was on a hamster wheel of finding and using the latest mail client, RSS reader, to-do list, etc.

I still keep my ear to the ground about the hot new productivity app but I have to be really sure itâ€™s sticking around before I swap away from the default Apple option. Appleâ€™s apps donâ€™t always have the latest flashy features but I generally expect them to be around for the next five years.

Without further adieu, here are my default apps:

ğŸ“¨ Mail Client

  • Apple Mail

ğŸ“® Mail Server

  • GSuite (Is it still called this? Iâ€™m considering switching to FastMail but havenâ€™t pulled the trigger yet.)

ğŸ“ Notes

  • Apple Notes

âœ… To-Do

  • Apple Reminders

ğŸ“· iPhone Photo Shooting

  • Apple Camera

ğŸŸ¦ Photo Management

  • iCloud Photos / Apple Photos

ğŸ“† Calendar

  • Fantastical

ğŸ“ Cloud File Storage

  • iCloud Drive

ğŸ“– RSS

  • N/A (I used Feedbin after the death of Google Reader but I no longer use RSS much at all anymore.)

ğŸ™ğŸ»â€â™‚ï¸ Contacts

  • Apple Contacts

ğŸŒ Browser

  • Safari / Firefox / Chrome in that order.

ğŸ’¬ Chat

  • Apple Messages and one Slack

ğŸ”– Bookmarks

  • N/A (I usually save links in Apple Reminders or Apple Notes, depending on the context.)

ğŸ“‘ Read It Later

  • Ephemera (This one is my app. Itâ€™s simple and unique. Check it out!)

ğŸ“œ Word Processing

  • Apple Notes / TextEdit / Pages

ğŸ“ˆ Spreadsheets

  • Numbers (I would use Excel in a heartbeat if I had any services spreadsheeting to do.)

ğŸ“Š Presentations

  • N/A

ğŸ›’ Shopping Lists

  • Apple Reminders

ğŸ´ Meal Planning

  • Mela

ğŸ’° Budgeting and Personal Finance

  • Copilot (Iâ€™m not convinced this is the app for me. Itâ€™s pretty but the Fidelity integration does not work. Iâ€™m fielding suggestions. Let me know!)

ğŸ“° News

  • Apple News

ğŸµ Music

  • Apple Music

ğŸ¤ Podcasts

  • Overcast

ğŸ” Password Management

  • 1Password (Thinking about switching to the native keychain implementation, but Iâ€™ve got my family on the 1Password family plan and it sounds like a pain in the butt for me to switch.)

Iâ€™m a sucker for learning about other peopleâ€™s workflows and seeing how I can make better use of my time, so this was right up my alley.

In recent years I have drastically simplified the amount of third party apps I use. I felt like I was on a hamster wheel of finding and using the latest mail client, RSS reader, to-do list, etc. 

I still keep my ear to the ground about the hot new productivity app but I have to be really sure itâ€™s sticking around before I swap away from the default Apple option. Appleâ€™s apps donâ€™t always have the latest flashy features but I generally expect them to be around for the next five years.

items.content_html:
Hello!

I am going to try posting a bit here. I have always struggled to keep a blogging routine. My plan is to treat it a lot more causally than I have in the past.

Let the fun (and posting) begin!
